Member Function Documentation

void InputManager::CopyFrom ( InputManager *  other)

Sets all variables of this instance to match the other instance.

void InputManager::DeregisterKeyboardInputEventHandler ( IInputEventHandler *  eventHandler,
std::vector< KeyCode >  keyCodes 
)

Deregister a KeyReleaseEventHandler which will no longer receive KeyReleaseEvents.

Parameters
[in]handlerPointer to the KeyReleaseEventHandler to deregister. If the handler has an existing registration with this InputManager, the registration will be modified. Otherwise, this function has no effect.
[in]keyCodesVector of key codes int values corresponding to keyboard keys that should no be received by the event handler. If the handler has an existing registration with this InputManager, the registration will be updated with the relative complement of the contents of this vector with respect to the key codes in the existing registration. If the result of this operation is an empty set, the handler's registration will be removed from this InputManager.
void InputManager::DeregisterMouseInputEventHandler ( IInputEventHandler *  eventHandler)

Deregister an event handler which will no longer receive mouse input events.

Parameters
[in]eventHandlerPointer to the IInputEventHandler to deregister. If the event handler has an existing registration with this InputManager, the registration will be removed. Otherwise, this function has no effect.
InputState InputManager::GetKeyState ( KeyCode  keyCode)

Poll the current state of a key.

Parameters
keyCodeKey code corresponding to a keyboard key.
Returns
InputState indicating the current state of a key. If an invalid key code was passed, KeyState::Invalid is returned.
int InputManager::GetMouseAbsoluteX ( )
int InputManager::GetMouseAbsoluteY ( )
InputState InputManager::GetMouseButtonState ( MouseCode  mouseCode)
MouseInputMode InputManager::GetMouseInputMode ( )

Get the current mouse cursor behavior.

Returns
one of the following: MouseInputMode::SHOW - The operating system cursor is being drawn. MouseInputMode::HIDE - The operating system cursor is hidden. MouseInputMode::HIDE_AND_LOCK - The operating system cursor is hidden and the cursor is locked to the game window.
bool InputManager::IsRegisteredEventHandler ( KeyCode *  keyCode)

True if the given KeyCode has at least one registered release event handler. False otherwise.

void InputManager::OnKeyboardKeyPress ( KeyPressEvent *  event)
virtual

Implemented from IKeyPressEventHandler. Distributes event to registered event handlers. Should be called only by InputView.

Reimplemented from IInputEventHandler.

void InputManager::OnKeyboardKeyRelease ( KeyReleaseEvent *  event)
virtual

Implemented from IKeyReleaseEventHandler. Distributes event to registered event handlers. Should be called only by InputView.

Reimplemented from IInputEventHandler.

void InputManager::OnMouseButtonPress ( MouseButtonPressEvent *  event)
virtual

Implemented from IMouseButtonPressEventHandler. Distributes event to registered event handlers. Should be called only by InputView.

Reimplemented from IInputEventHandler.

void InputManager::OnMouseButtonRelease ( MouseButtonReleaseEvent *  event)
virtual

Implemented from IMouseButtonReleaseEventHandler. Distributes event to registered event handlers. Should be called only by InputView.

Reimplemented from IInputEventHandler.

void InputManager::OnMouseInput ( MouseEvent *  event)
virtual

Implemented from IMouseEventHandler. Distributes event to registered event handlers. Should be called only by InputView.

Reimplemented from IInputEventHandler.

void InputManager::RegisterKeyboardInputEventHandler ( IInputEventHandler *  eventHandler,
std::vector< KeyCode >  keyCodes 
)

Register an event handler to receive keyboard input events.

Parameters
[in]handlerPointer to the IInputEventHandler to register. If the handler does not have an existing registration with this InputManager, a new registration will be created. Otherwise, the existing registration will be modified.
[in]keyCodesVector of key codes corresponding to keyboard keys that the event handler will receive. If the handler does not have an existing registration with this InputManager, the new registration will be initialized with the contents of this vector. Otherwise, the registration will be updated with the set union of the contents of this vector and the key codes in the existing registration.
void InputManager::RegisterMouseInputEventHandler ( IInputEventHandler *  eventHandler)

Register an event handler to receive mouse input events.

Parameters
[in]eventHandlerPointer to the IInputEventHandler to register. If the event handler does not have an existing registration with this InputManager, a new registration will be created. Otherwise, this function has no effect.
void InputManager::SetMouseInputMode ( MouseInputMode  mode)

Set the mouse cursor behavior.

Parameters
modeone of the following: MouseInputMode::SHOW - Draw the operating system cursor. MouseInputMode::HIDE - Hide the operating system cursor. MouseInputMode::HIDE_AND_LOCK - Hide the operating system cursor and lock the cursor to the game window.
void InputManager::SetView ( InputView *  inputView)

Associate an InputView with this InputManager. The InputView specified here will be used to poll input state on demand. Only one InputView may be associated with an InputManager at a time.
